description: The application is to rezone the lands at 1805 Victoria Drive from RT-5 (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to increase the FSR from 0.6 to 2.0 and the building height from 10.7 m to 20.9 m, to permit a four-storey building containing a firehall and office space for the Vancouver Fire and Rescue Services.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 1805 Victoria Drive
The application is to rezone the lands at 1805 Victoria Drive from RT-5 (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District to increase the FSR from 0.6 to 2.0 and the building height from 10.7 m to 20.9 m, to permit a four-storey building containing a firehall and office space for the Vancouver Fire and Rescue Services. The proposed form of development is generally as prepared by HCMA Architecture and Design received October 13, 2023, subject to the Director of Planning's approval of the detailed scheme. The application is enabled through the Grandview-Woodland Community Plan, and the proposed uses and form of development meet the Plan's intent, subject to design development and other conditions.

description: The application is to rezone the lands at 8815-8827 Selkirk Street from MC-1 (Industrial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The proposal is for a six-storey mixed-use building containing 36 secured market rental units and live-work space. The proposed height is 21 m (69 ft.) and the FSR is 2.50, increased from the current 12.2 m (40 ft.) height and 0.75 FSR.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 8815-8827 Selkirk Street
The application is to rezone the lands at 8815-8827 Selkirk Street from MC-1 (Industrial) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The proposal is for a six-storey mixed-use building containing 36 secured market rental units and live-work space. description: The report evaluates an application to rezone 5350-5430 Heather Street from R1-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 0.70 to 6.28 and the building height from 11.5 m to 60 m to permit two 18-storey residential buildings with 344 rental units, of which 20% would be below-market rental units.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 5350-5430 Heather Street
The report evaluates an application to rezone 5350-5430 Heather Street from R1-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 0.70 to 6.28 and the building height from 11.5 m to 60 m to permit two 18-storey residential buildings with 344 rental units, of which 20% would be below-market rental units. The proposed use and form of development are consistent with the Cambie Corridor Plan. The rezoning application and plans are referred to Public Hearing with the recommendation of the General Manager to approve the application, subject to conditions. The Director of Legal Services is instructed to prepare the necessary by-law(s) and Housing Agreement By-law for consideration at the Public Hearing.

description: The report recommends an amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from CD-1(26) (Comprehensive Development) District to RR-3B (Residential Rental) District for 4635 Arbutus Street. The amendment would allow for a six-storey, mixed-use rental building of which 20% of the residential floor area is secured as below-market rental units, in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy (SRP). An estimated total of 74 secured rental units may be delivered through this application. The site area is approximately 1,762 sq. m (18,966 sq. ft.) with a frontage of 41.3 m (135.5 ft.) along Arbutus Street and a depth of 42.7 m (140 ft.). The current uses on the rezoning site, 4635 Arbutus Street, are a two-storey commercial building constructed in 1965 and a surface parking lot.

rawSummaries.summary:
Rezoning: 4635-4675 Arbutus Street
The report recommends an amendment to the Zoning and Development By-law from CD-1(26) (Comprehensive Development) District to RR-3B (Residential Rental) District for 4635 Arbutus Street. The amendment would allow for a six-storey, mixed-use rental building of which 20% of the residential floor area is secured as below-market rental units, in accordance with the Secured Rental Policy (SRP). An estimated total of 74 secured rental units may be delivered through this application. The site area is approximately 1,762 sq. m (18,966 sq. ft.) with a frontage of 41.3 m (135.5 ft.) along Arbutus Street and a depth of 42.7 m (140 ft.). The current uses on the rezoning site, 4635 Arbutus Street, are a two-storey commercial building constructed in 1965 and a surface parking lot. The property does not contain residential rental tenancies and the Tenant Relocation and Protection Policy (TRPP) does not apply.

description: The application is to rezone from C-3A to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 3.0 to 8.5 and the height from 30 ft. to 295 ft. with additional height for the portion with rooftop amenity, to permit a mixed-use development with 28-storey (west tower) and 21-storey (east tower) buildings connected with a single-storey podium, with 514 secured rental units, commercial uses and a 37-space turn-key childcare facility.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 130-150 West Broadway and 2520 Columbia Street
The application by Arcadis, on behalf 130 West Broadway Investments Inc., is to rezone from C-3A to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 3.0 to 8.5 and the height from 30 ft. to 295 ft. with additional height for the portion with rooftop amenity, to permit a mixed-use development with 28-storey (west tower) and 21-storey (east tower) buildings connected with a single-storey podium, with 514 secured rental units, commercial uses and a 37-space turn-key childcare facility. The draft CD-1 By-law and the proposed form of development are approved in principle, subject to the Conditions of Approval contained in Appendix B. The Director of Legal Services is instructed to prepare the necessary Housing Agreement By-law for enactment prior to enactment of the CD-1 By-law. The application to amend the Sign By-law and the Noise Control By-law to establish regulations for the new CD-1 are also approved.

description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a 7-storey (Z/D 6-storey) Community Care Facility - Class B noncombustible building consists of
1st storey - independent living units,
2nd and 3rd storeys - memory care units,
3rd and 4th storeys - assisted living units,
5th and 6th storeys - independent living units,
7th storey - amenity space and exterior occupied roof deck,
All over on level of underground parking with vehicle access from lane.
Shared amenity spaces will be located on Levels P1 through 4th storey.
Occupants in the independent living and assisted living units are free to move around in their respective floor areas and to leave the area/exit the building with no restrictions. Memory care occupants will be in an impeded egress zone and will require the release, by security personnel, of doors to the exit stairs and security doors before they are able to leave the area.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511) with amendments effective on September 7, 2023.
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements. The building is designed with High Building measures.
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.
The building will be equipped with 2-stage Fire Alarm System.
STAGED CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued April 22, 2024

description: The report evaluates an application to rezone 5755-5791 Oak Street and 1008 West 41st Avenue from C-1 to CD-1 to permit a mixed-use development with 25-storey and 17-storey buildings, 357 secured-rental units (20% below-market), and commercial uses.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 5755-5791 Oak Street and 1008 West 41st Avenue
The report evaluates an application to rezone 5755-5791 Oak Street and 1008 West 41st Avenue from C-1 to CD-1 to permit a mixed-use development with 25-storey and 17-storey buildings, 357 secured-rental units (20% below-market), and commercial uses. The application exceeds the anticipated height and density, but staff support it based on the changing context, emerging directions in the Vancouver Plan, and the delivery of 357 secured rental housing units including a portion of below-market units. The report recommends referring the rezoning application and plans to Public Hearing with the recommendation of the General Manager of Planning, Urban Design and Sustainability to approve the application, subject to conditions. The Director of Legal Services is instructed to prepare the necessary by-laws for consideration at the Public Hearing, including a Housing Agreement By-law and an amendment to the Noise Control By-law.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 7525 Cambie Street
The application by Wesgroup Properties, on behalf of West 59th Avenue & Cambie Street Investments Ltd., is to rezone the lands at 7525 Cambie Street from C-1 to CD-1 to increase the FSR from 1.20 to 3.22 and the height from 10.7 m to 23.8 m to permit a six-storey mixed-use building with 67 strata-titled residential units and commercial space. The proposed uses and form of development are consistent with the Cambie Corridor Plan. The application is recommended for approval in principle, subject to a Public Hearing, and conditions.

description: The application is to rezone the lands at 1302-1318 East 12th Avenue from RM-11N (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The proposed changes are to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 1.70 to 3.21 and the maximum building height from 13.7 m (45 ft.) to 24.18 m (79 ft.) to permit a six-storey mixed-use building containing 33 secured market rental residential units with commercial space on the ground floor.

rawSummaries.summary:
CD-1 Rezoning: 1302-1318 East 12th Avenue
The application by David Wong Architect, on behalf of XGX Apartments Ltd., is to rezone the lands at 1302-1318 East 12th Avenue from RM-11N (Residential) District to CD-1 (Comprehensive Development) District. The proposed changes are to increase the maximum floor space ratio (FSR) from 1.70 to 3.21 and the maximum building height from 13.7 m (45 ft.) to 24.18 m (79 ft.) to permit a six-storey mixed-use building containing 33 secured market rental residential units with commercial space on the ground floor. The proposed form of development is generally approved, with the Director of Planning allowed to make minor alterations. The application is recommended for approval in principle, subject to the Public Hearing and Conditions of Approval.

description: to permit the development of a two-storey 3,092-square-metre commercial building. The proposal includes a LAP Amendment from "Open Space Corridor/Buffer" and "Business Park" to "Commercial" and a Rezoning from A-1 to CD (based on C-8).

Agent: Architecture Panel Inc. (Ruchir Dhall)

- LAP Amendment from "Open Space Corridor/Buffer" and "Business Park" to "Commercial"

applicant: 1441172 B.C. Ltd. (Directors: H. Dhillon, D. Dhillon, I. Nagra, G. Sandhu, A. Villing)
description: The proposed development includes an OCP Amendment to redesignate a portion of the site from 'Mixed Employment' to 'Multiple Residential', allow an FAR of 2.5 within the 'Multiple Residential' land use designation, and remove the 'Mixed Employment' designation from the site. An NCP Amendment is proposed to introduce a new 'Mixed Use 4-6 Storeys' land use designation and redesignate the site accordingly, as well as remove the land consolidation requirement. A LAP Amendment is proposed to redesignate the site from 'Buffers' to 'Mixed Commercial Residential'. The application also includes a rezoning from RA to CD (based on RM-70) to permit a 6-storey mixed-use building, a Housing Agreement, and a Development Permit.

Agent: Flat Architecture Inc. (Rajinder Warraich)

- OCP Amendment to redesignate a portion of the site from 'Mixed Employment' to 'Multiple Residential'
- OCP Amendment to allow an FAR of 2.5 for the site within the 'Multiple Residential' land use designation
- OCP Amendment to remove the 'Mixed Employment' designation from the site on Figure 42: Major Employment Areas
- NCP Amendment to introduce a new 'Mixed Use 4-6 Storeys' land use designation and redesignate the site from 'Multiple Residential 30-45 upa', '20m Drainage Corridor' and 'Road' to 'Mixed Use 4-6 Storeys' and '10m Drainage Corridor', and remove the land consolidation requirement
- LAP Amendment to redesignate the site from 'Buffers' to 'Mixed Commercial Residential'
- Rezoning from RA to CD (based on RM-70) to permit a 6-storey mixed-use building
- Housing Agreement
- Development Permit

Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a 7-storey (Z&D 6-storey) mixed-use combustible residential building, consisting of
1st and 2nd storeys - retail shell and two 2-storey dwelling units,
3rd to 7th storeys - multiple dwelling units,
all over 2 levels of below grade parking having vehicular access from lane.
Building to be noncombustible construction below 2nd storey slab and combustible construction for the remainder of the building, related to AL-2024-00003 for combustible construction.
Total dwelling units = 77.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511) with amendments effective on January 19, 2024.
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.
All tenant spaces require separate tenant improvement permits.
STAGED CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued April 5, 2024
Revision 1 - Reduce excavation depth and soil anchors. - in review
